experiment_name: Alkylation of Ethyl Acetoacetate with Bis(4-fluorophenyl)methylene Chloride
experiment_description: Alkylation of Ethyl Acetoacetate (as a substitute for Diethyl Acetamidomalonate) with Bis(4-fluorophenyl)methylene chloride using Sodium Hydride as a base and Tetra-n-butylammonium iodide as a catalyst. Required instruments: RoundBottomFlask, HeatingPlate, SeparatoryFunnel, RotaryEvaporator, LiquidChromatograph. Required reagents: EthylAcetoacetate, SodiumHydride, Bis4FluorophenylMethyleneChloride, TetraNButylammoniumIodide, Dimethylformamide.

chemical_constraints.description: Keep flammable solvents away from heat sources
All reagents must be stored in reagent cabinet
All reagents must be stored in reagent cabinet
Sodium Hydride is incompatible with Water
HeatingPlate should be in the FumeHood for this reaction

procedure.description: Retrieve EthylAcetoacetate, SodiumHydride, Bis4FluorophenylMethyleneChloride, TetraNButylammoniumIodide, Dimethylformamide, EthylAcetate, SodiumChloride, and Acetonitrile from reagent_cabinet and place them in the FumeHood.
procedure.safety_notes: Handle reagents with care; wear PPE.

procedure.description: Weigh SodiumHydride using ElectronicScale and transfer to a dry RoundBottomFlask. Measure Dimethylformamide using GraduatedCylinder and add to the flask.
procedure.safety_notes: Sodium Hydride reacts with moisture; keep flask dry. Work in FumeHood.

procedure.description: Measure EthylAcetoacetate using a Pipette and add it dropwise to the RoundBottomFlask. Stir the mixture at room temperature for 1 hour to allow enolate formation.
Weigh TetraNButylammoniumIodide using ElectronicScale and add to the flask. Measure Bis4FluorophenylMethyleneChloride using a Pipette and add to the mixture.
Place the RoundBottomFlask on the HeatingPlate. Insert Thermometer. Heat the reaction mixture to 50°C for 16 hours, then increase to 80°C for another 16 hours.
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature. Carefully add Water dropwise to quench any unreacted SodiumHydride.
procedure.safety_notes: Exothermic reaction with gas evolution. Add water very slowly.

procedure.description: Transfer the mixture to a SeparatoryFunnel. Add EthylAcetate and shake to extract. Separate the organic layer. Wash the organic layer with SodiumChloride solution (brine). Collect the organic phase in a Beaker.
procedure.safety_notes: Vent SeparatoryFunnel frequently to release pressure.

procedure.description: Transfer the organic phase to the RotaryEvaporator and remove the solvent under reduced pressure.
procedure.safety_notes: Ensure proper vacuum seal and cooling.

procedure.description: Dissolve a small sample of the residue in Acetonitrile and analyze using the LiquidChromatograph.

safety_warnings: Sodium Hydride is water-reactive and flammable; handle under inert conditions if possible.
Bis(4-fluorophenyl)methylene chloride is toxic and an irritant.
Dimethylformamide is a potent solvent and toxic; avoid skin contact.
Always work in the Fume Hood when handling volatile or hazardous chemicals.
notes: EthylAcetoacetate is used as the substrate in place of Diethyl Acetamidomalonate due to library availability, following the same alkylation protocol.
